description: From Middle English creatour, from Old French creator, creatur, creatour, from Latin creātor, agent noun from perfect passive participle creātus (“created”), from verb creō (“I create”) + agent suffix -or. Mostly displaced native Old English wyrhta (modern English wright).

nouns.description: creator (plural creators, feminine creatress or creatrix)

entries.meaning: Something or someone which creates or makes something.
examples: Kenneth E. Iverson was the creator of APL.

entries.meaning: (social media) Ellipsis of content creator, someone who regularly produces and publishes content on social media, especially of a monetizable nature.
(religion, sometimes capitalized) The deity that created the world.
(sports) A player who creates opportunities for their team to score goals; a playmaker.
